ovdesc.p: The EB.CONTRACT.BALANCES file records the information held in the CENTRAL.REPORTING FILE '(CRF)' down at contract level.

Account balances, principal outstanding amounts in product files and any related amount fields such as interest reserves, accrued charges, commissions, etc. held for each contract may be viewed into records held on the EB.CONTRACT.BALANCES.
The Key to the balances file is either the contract itself or the contract and an additional element. The data in the record relates to a single consol key and therefore currency.
The purpose of this file is to :
1. Allow the user to see the online effect of a transaction to the CRF
2. provide drill down information from a reporting line
3. be used as the basis for the CRB rebuild
4. be used as the basis for CRB static changes.
Both current and historical details are maintained providing a means by which the system can control and record all financial transactions.
This file also provides a valuable source of information for enquiry and reporting purposes for both bank and customer requirements.

The file is updated automatically by any transaction (either online or during the close of business) that modifies CRB balance details. There is no facility for direct input to this file. The only functions that users are allowed to perform are "L"ist, "S"ee, and "P"rint.
The information is held on this file includes:
o Multi-valued set of fields detailing CRB asset types and associated value date,
maturity date, and amount of outstanding CRB balance.

The information held here is in the following format:
BALANCE.TYPE – [SYSTEM.DATE]
The BALANCE.TYPE is the Asset type of the underlying entry to that contract.
It may be related to the Principal balances or amount fields such as interest reserves, accrued charges, commissions, etc.
BALANCE.TYPE will only be populated if supplied on the underlying entry.
SYSTEM.DATE is the date on which the entry for that balance type has been raised.
Note:
The first transaction posted to an Account will update the Balance.Type ‘NILOPEN’. The COB will then move it under the correct Balance.Type according to the sign of the Account(DEBIT or CREDIT).
Each time the EB.CONTRACT.BALANCES is updated, the balances and movements are merged under the corresponding Balance.Type leaving out the dates(for the dates prior to the last working day).
A valid hard-coded Balance.Type or a composite of Balance.Type-System.date

This field holds a flag to indicate if the contract has changed sign during the day. It is automatically set to ‘Y’ if CURR.ASSET.TYPE not equal to OPEN.ASSET.TYPE.

For example if a debit transaction has caused the sign of an account to move from credit to debit, then the Open.Asset.Type would be ‘CREDIT’ while the CURR.ASSET.TYPE would be ‘DEBIT’ and the POSS.SIGN.CHANGE would be set to ‘Y’.
The Close of Business would then :
1 Raise the required entries to move the balance of this contract from the CREDIT side to the
DEBIT side of the Consolidate.Asset.Liab record
2 Initialise the flag.
‘Y’ or blank

Field to hold the total authorised payable movements for future dated cash based movements to an account under Trade date GL Accounting.

Customer’s account and bank’s positions will be updated on the value date but the movements from the trade will he held under “Payable” Balances in the Balance Sheet GL on the trade date until the value date.
When the transaction amount is credit, balance will be updated in this field and the non-contingent asset type 'PAY'.
Standard Amount Format
Internal file, no input
Field to hold the total authorised receivable movements for future dated cash based movements to an account under Trade date GL Accounting.

Customer’s account and bank’s positions will be updated on the value date but the movements from the trade will he held under “Receivable” Balances in the Balance Sheet GL on the trade date until the value date.
When the transaction amount is debit, balance will be updated in this field and the non-contingent asset type 'RECEIVE'.
Standard Amount Format

Balance field that will represent the cash balance of an Account including future dated movements that will be processed to the account irrespective of the accounting system.
It is the sum of the ONLINE.ACTUAL.BALANCE + AUTH.PAY.MVMT + AUTH.RECEIVE.MVMT.
Whenever ONLINE.ACTUAL.BALANACE is affected, this balance field will be recalculated and updated irrespective of the accounting system.
This field is used for credit checking.
